page.title: 06CAR,BIKE,APPLETON WISKE
page.content: There is a high level of car ownership in Appleton and Hornby.On the results of a small survey 45% of households own 1 car,54% own two or more cars. Only 1% of households have no car.The most important uses of the car are for travelling to work and shopping,80% of employed people work outside the district.62% of households own 1 or more bicycles,which are mostly used for pleasure,3 families use their bikes as transport to work or for shopping one family goes on cycling holidays.23% of households reguard cycling as a heathly exercise.7% of households own a motorbike or scooter and half of them use their motorbikes for travelling to work and shopping 23% of households own some kind of watercraft,canoes and and dinghys being the most widely owned,rowing boats,sail boats and powerboats also.
